sen.j: 塵塚怪王（ちりづかかいおう）は、日本に伝わる妖怪の一種。
sen.e: Chirizuka-kaio (ghost king of waste) is a Japanese specter.

sen.j: 名前通り、ごみの付喪神たちの王とされる。
sen.e: As the name indicates, it is considered as the king of the Tsukumo-gami (gods to a variety of things) of waste.

As the name indicates, it is considered as the king of waste-related tsukumogami (the term tsukumogami refers to a type of Japanese spirits that originate in items or artifacts that have reached their 100th birthday and become alive).

sen.j: 鳥山石燕の『百器徒然袋』には、唐櫃をこじ開ける鬼の姿で描かれている。
sen.e: In "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro (One hundred bags in idlenss)" by Sekien TORIYAMA, it is portrayed in the figure of a ogre who prizes a karabitsu (Chinese-style chest) open.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In Sekien TORIYAMA's "Hyakki Tsurezure Bukuro" (The Bag of One Hundred Random Demons; the term 'hyakki' in its title is a pun on the usual hyakki, replacing the character for demon which is written as "鬼" in Japanese with a character for vessel written as "器," and sure enough, most of the yokais shown in this book are the tsukumogami), it is portrayed as an ogre who prizes a karabitsu (Chinese-style chest) open.

sen.j: また『徒然草』第72段に「多くて見苦しからぬは、文車の文、塵塚の塵」という一文がある。

sen.j: 『百器徒然袋』には『百鬼夜行絵巻』や『徒然草』をもとにしたものが多いことから、この塵塚怪王もそれらをもとに石燕が創作したものといわれる。
